newsitem.title: USA: AirTouch ups stake in Portuguese operator.
newsitem.headline: AirTouch ups stake in Portuguese operator.

text.p: AirTouch Communications said it raised its stake in Portuguese cellular operator Telecel-Comunicacoes Pessoais to 51 percent.
It previously held a 39 percent stake and is now the majority shareholder.

Telecel just completed an initial public offering (IPO) of 7,645,000 shares. The underwriters also have exercised their option to buy up to 763,650 additional shares to cover over-allotments, bringing the total IPO to 39 percent of the company, AirTouch said.
The shares are listed on the Lisbon Stock Exchange and quoted on the SEAQ International. About 20 percent of the shares were sold in the U.S. under Rule 144A.

The price per share was set at 7,950 escudos (about $51), for a total offering of around 67 billion escudos (about $425 million). Demand for the total offering was 15 times greater than supply. The company said the offering was Portugal's largest-ever IPO by a non-governmental company. The proceeds went to Telepri-Telecomunicacoes Privadas, the selling shareholder.
AirTouch, through its European subsidiary, purchased its additional shares from Telepri in a separate transaction.
